prosody.p: Hi Heather and Keith, welcome to day 3 of your trip! Today we'll be exploring Iceland's spectacular South Coast, discovering treasures that showcase the raw power of nature's ongoing creation.

Our journey takes us from Selfoss through an incredible landscape of thundering waterfalls, dramatic black sand beaches, and towering sea stacks. You'll walk behind the cascading waters of Seljalandsfoss, feel the raw power of Skógafoss, and explore the otherworldly black beaches of Vikurfjara and Reynisfjara. We'll end at the majestic Dyrhólaey peninsula before reaching our cozy accommodation at The Barn.

p.emphasis: Before we begin, here are some words from Nobel laureate Halldór Laxness, Iceland's greatest writer, that capture the spirit of this remarkable landscape:

p.prosody: "The water runs on its way to the sea, with no other thought than to fall and rise, to live the life that has been ordained for it; a raindrop perhaps that fell onto a mountainside a thousand years ago."

prosody.p: Let our adventure begin as we trace the path of Iceland's waters from ancient glacier to powerful waterfall to the vast and turbulent sea.
